sentences.english: "I dance rather well for a cowboy, " he told her amusedly.
sentences.chinese: “就牛仔而言，我舞跳得很好，”他乐呵呵告诉她。“

sentences.english: Mr. Wilson isn't in one of his 'ho-ho-ho' moods today, is he?
sentences.chinese: 威尔逊先生今天怎么不乐呵呵的了？

sentences.english: "Careful not to cut yourselves, " Tao shouted out cheerily.
sentences.chinese: “小心不要被割伤，”导游陶乐呵呵地提醒道。

sentences.english: He always happy and never shared his parents' worries.
sentences.chinese: 他总是乐呵呵的，从不分担父母亲的忧愁。

sentences.english: Not surprisingly, the cheerful bunch wanted to be happy.
sentences.chinese: 毫无悬念，乐呵呵的一伙想要快乐。

sentences.english: They'd greet you with a grin.
sentences.chinese: 他们乐呵呵地跟你打招呼。

sentences.english: And yet she was a happy woman, and a woman whom no one named without good-will.
sentences.chinese: 不过她倒是个乐呵呵的女人，谁说起她都觉得她不错。

sentences.english: He was always cheerful and devoted himself heart and soul to his work.
sentences.chinese: 他总是乐呵呵的，一直全身心地扑在工作上。

sentences.english: At 1 p. m. , Grannie Zhang cheerfully stood up and went home to make something to eat.
sentences.chinese: 下午1点钟，张大娘乐呵呵地起身回家做饭。

sentences.english: 'The Chinese are smiling all the way to the bank, ' Mr. Romney said.
sentences.chinese: 罗姆尼说，中国人正在乐呵呵地数钱。

sentences.english: He’s a cheerful guy, but Monday morning found him miserable.
sentences.chinese: 他是一个乐呵呵的人，但周一早上却是一副可怜相。

definition: brows raised in delight, eyes laughing (idiom); beaming with joy/all smiles
happy and excited (idiom)/in high spirits/in great delight
grinning from ear to ear (idiom)/beaming with happiness
joyfully satisfied/to be immensely proud of oneself/proudly/an air of complacency
smile spread across the face (idiom); beaming with pleasure/all smiles/joy written across one's face
not in the least concerned (idiom)/reckless/couldn't give a damn about it/unperturbed/couldn't care less/harum scarum
